page_analysis.text_content:
Gross vs. net lot area

Gross lot area is the size of the lot—from lot line to lot line.
Development potential is based on the net lot area and
while gross and net lot area are the same for most lots in
Palo Alto, there are some lots for which portions must be
excluded from the gross lot area to establish the net lot area.

Areas excluded from the gross lot size are:
• Street right-of-way (Area A of Fig 1 on this page)
• "Pole" portion of a flag lot (Area B of Fig 2 on this page)
• Creek channel (Area C of Fig 3 on this page)

Fig 1 Gross lot area exclusions: street easements

[Diagram showing lot with boundaries that extend into the public ROW]

The portion of the lot within the public ROW must be subtracted from the gross lot area.

Notes: In some areas of Palo Alto, like Barron Park, it is not unusual for the lot to extend to the middle of the street. However, for zoning purposes, the lot is defined by the edge of the public street easement or public right-of-way (ROW). Dimensions for the public ROW are available at the Development Center.

Fig 2 Gross lot area exclusions: flag-lot "poles"

[Diagram showing flag lot containing private easement and flag lot with pole]

pole* portion of a lot must be subtracted from the gross lot size

* Private access easements to that provide access to lots are NOT subtracted from the lot on which they occur.

Fig 3 Gross lot area exclusions: creek easements

[Diagram showing lot with creek and/or creek easement]

The portion of the lot within a creek channel must be subtracted from gross lot size.

Notes: The channel or area to be subtracted is defined by Santa Clara Valley Water District's easement or, if there is no easement, the top-of-bank. Determining the top-of-bank may require a surveyor.

Key
Curb
Sidewalk
Lot lines
Creek
Area that must be subtracted from gross lot area

3

visual_elements.description: Figure 1 shows a lot with boundaries that extend into the public right-of-way (ROW). The diagram illustrates how the portion of the lot within the public ROW (labeled as Area A) must be subtracted from the gross lot area. Shows street, sidewalk, and lot boundaries with hatched area indicating the portion to be excluded.

Figure 2 shows flag lot configurations with private easements and poles. Illustrates flag lot containing private easement on the left and flag lot with pole on the right. Shows how the pole portion (Area B) of a flag lot must be subtracted from the gross lot size. Includes note about private access easements.

Figure 3 shows a lot with creek and/or creek easement. Illustrates how the portion of the lot within a creek channel (Area C) must be subtracted from gross lot size. Shows top of bank, creek easement boundaries, and street. Includes wavy lines representing creek water.
Legend showing symbols for: Curb (hatched lines), Sidewalk (hatched lines), Lot lines (solid lines), Creek (wavy lines), and Area that must be subtracted from gross lot area (outlined areas)

Fig 3 Gross lot area exclusions: creek easements

logical_relationships.expression: Areas excluded from the gross lot size are: Street right-of-way OR "Pole" portion of a flag lot OR Creek channel

execution_sequence.action: Determine if lot has areas that must be excluded from gross lot area
Subtract street right-of-way area if present
Subtract pole portion of flag lot if present
Subtract creek channel area if present
